Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.Message

Class GameMessage

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Message.GameMessage
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BuildMessage, MoveMessage, TileToShowMessage, WinMessage
public abstract class GameMessage
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
This is the abstract class representing all the message that are generated within the MVC core of our project. Every message generate by a change of the Model will have 3 important attributes: - message: an helper string used to generate the correct message which will be shown to the user - idPlayer: the id (a String) of the player who generate this message - currentPhase: the phase within the message was generated All this message will be used to set the correct MiniController to the correct Client, and to modify their PlaySpace (and GUI if they use this client mode)
See Also:
Serialized Form

    • autoSetMessage

      public abstract void autoSetMessage​(boolean isMyTurn, boolean isCLI)
      This method is used to generate automatically the correct message that will be shown to the player. This method will be call only on the Client, because requires information not known by the Server.
      Parameters:
      isMyTurn - boolean telling if it's the player turn
      isCLI - boolean telling if the Client is a CLI one

    • updatePlaySpace

      public abstract void updatePlaySpace​(PlaySpace playSpace)
      This method is used to update the PlaySpace on the Client
      Parameters:
      playSpace - The Client's PlaySpace

    • updateGUI

      public abstract void updateGUI​(PlaySpace playSpace)
      This method is used only by the GUI Client, and will used different method in the PlaySpace class to change the visual representation of the Game state
      Parameters:
      playSpace - Client's PlaySpace that represents the Board and the current state of the Game
